allSaves.value: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

details.flavorText: Taiga linnorms are covered in hundreds of quill-like black spines as sharp as spears. Wise hunters native to linnorm-infested lands know to watch for spines stuck in the bark of conifersâ€”a sure sign that a taiga linnorm has recently passed through. Sometimes this means of tracking isn't enough to avoid an encounter, however; taiga linnorms, like their tarn and tor brethren, are skilled stalkers. They prefer to lurk in half-frozen bogs or swampy marshlands with their heads poking just above the water's surface, ever watchful for unwary prey.

description.value: You repel effects that would hinder a creature or slow its movement. While under this spell's effect, the target ignores effects that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed. When they attempt to Escape an effect that has them @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, they automatically succeed unless the effect is magical and of a higher level than the freedom of movement spell.
description.label: Description

description.value: You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creatureâ€™s true form, but you donâ€™t end the polymorph spell).
description.label: Description

description.value: When a creature slays a taiga linnorm, it must succeed at a DC 46 Will save or permanently gain weakness 20 to electricity.

Any creature that makes a melee attack against a taiga linnorm is stabbed by the taiga linnorm's spines and takes [[/r 1d6 # piercing damage]] piercing damage per attack. A melee weapon with reach protects the user against these spines.

This monster regains the listed number of Hit Points each round at the beginning of its turn. Its @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.Dying] condition never increases beyond @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.Dying] 3 as long as its regeneration is active. However, if it takes damage of a type listed in the regeneration entry, its regeneration deactivates until the end of its next turn. Deactivate the regeneration before applying any damage of a listed type, since that damage might kill the monster by bringing it to @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.Dying] 4.

The taiga linnorm breathes a 60-foot cone of electrified vapor, dealing [[/r 20d6 # electricity damage]] electricity damage to creatures in the area (DC 41 basic Reflex save). The electrified mist persists for 1d4 rounds, dealing [[/r 6d6 # electricity damage]] electricity damage (DC 41 basic Reflex save) to each creature that ends its turn in the mist. The taiga linnorm can't use Breath Weapon again for 1d4 rounds.

Saving Throw DC 42 Fortitude; Maximum Duration 10 rounds; Stage 1 [[/r 7d6 # electricity damage]] electricity damage and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.Drained] 1 (1 round); Stage 2 [[/r 10d6 # electricity damage]] electricity damage and drained 2 (1 round)

The monster can use Grab as a free action triggered by a hit with its initial attack. A monster with Improved Grab still needs to spend an action to extend the duration for creatures it already has grabbed.
Effect The monster automatically Grabs the target until the end of the monsterâ€™s next turn. The creature is grabbed by whichever body part the monster attacked with, and that body part canâ€™t be used to Strike creatures until the grab is ended.

Using Grab extends the duration of the monsterâ€™s Grab until the end of its next turn for all creatures grabbed by it. A grabbed creature can use the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Escape] action to get out of the grab, and the Grab ends for a grabbed creatures if the monster moves away from it.
